Hydrogen.fact: The most abundant element in the universe.

Water.fact: A universal solvent, crucial for life.

Gravity.fact: The fundamental force that shapes galaxies.

He.fact: The second most abundant element, product of fusion.

C.fact: The backbone of all known life.

Diamond.fact: One of the hardest known natural materials.

Life.fact: A characteristic that distinguishes physical entities that have biological processes.

Photosynthesis.fact: The process plants use to convert light into energy.

Species.fact: A group of living organisms consisting of similar individuals.

Civilization.fact: Any complex society characterized by urban development.

Planet.fact: A celestial body orbiting a star.

Star.fact: A luminous spheroid of plasma held together by its own gravity.

SolarSystem.fact: A star and all the objects that travel in orbit around it.

PlanetarySystem.fact: A set of gravitationally bound non-stellar objects in orbit around a star or star system.

Galaxy.fact: A gravitationally bound system of stars, stellar remnants, interstellar gas, dust, and dark matter.

Universe.fact: All of space and time and their contents.

Multiverse.fact: A hypothetical group of multiple universes.

Mountain.fact: A large natural elevation of the earth's surface.

Plant.fact: A living organism of the kind exemplified by trees, shrubs, herbs, grasses, ferns, and mosses.

Ecosystem.fact: A biological community of interacting organisms and their physical environment.

Biosphere.fact: The regions of the surface, atmosphere, and hydrosphere of the earth occupied by living organisms.

Technology.fact: The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes.

AdvancedCivilization.fact: A civilization that has reached a high level of technological advancement.

Habitat.fact: The natural home or environment of an animal, plant, or other organism.

Community.fact: A group of people living in the same place or having a particular characteristic in common.

Nation.fact: A large body of people united by common descent, history, culture, or language, inhabiting a particular country or territory.

Continent.fact: Any of the world's main continuous expanses of land.

Earth.fact: The planet on which we live; the world.

PlanetaryGalaxy.fact: A galaxy with a planetary system.

BinaryStar.fact: A system of two stars in which one star revolves around the other or both revolve around a common center.

ExoplanetSystem.fact: A planetary system that is outside our solar system.

AlienLife.fact: Life that does not originate from Earth.

MultiverseCivilization.fact: A civilization that spans multiple universes.
